reviewText: Back to my 70s days.... Thank you

For me is one of the best DVD for this kind of shows. Is simple very nice to see again the wonderful singers and groups after 30 years. The quality of the sound is 5 stars as the rest of DVD's (2).Thank you PBS and TJL for this precious material.

The show was nice to watch. It's a collection of music that will bring back memories to those who lived during and through the '70s. The younger folks can stop/listen and maybe appreciate what music their parents found to be hip at the time.

I got this dvd hoping to see those artists that i liked from many years ago to bring memories back from old times but instead i saw aged artists that try to act like what they were 30 years younger,i was diasspointed and this dvd did not appeale to me eventhogh  i still liked all those old songs

Many of these were issued with a bonus dvd. Below is the track list for both dvds.
DVD #1: 1. Get Ready - Rare Earth; 2. Still The One - Orleans; 3. Dream Weaver - Gary Wright; 4. Precious and Few - Climax; 5. Right Back Where We Started From - Maxine Nightingale; 6. Play That Funky Music - Wild Cherry; 7. When I Need You - Leo Sayer; 8. Drift Away - Dobie Gray; 9. Don't It Make My Brown Eyes Blue - Crystal Gayle; 10. Have You Seen Her - Chi-Lites; 11. Afternoon Delight - Starland Vocal Band; 12. I'd Really Like To See You Tonight - John Ford Coley; 13. Rock Me Gently - Andy Kim; 14. Let Your Love Flow - Bellamy Brothers; 15. I Just Want To Celebrate - Rare Earth; 16. Dance With Me - Orleans; 17. Midnight At The Oasis - Maria Muldaur; 18. Love Grows Where My Rosemary Goes - Edison Lighthouse; 19. Take A Letter Maria - RB Graves; 20. Dancing In The Moonlight - King Harvest; 21. Me and You and A Dog Named Boo - Lobo; 22. Ride Captain Ride - Blues Image; 23. Rock and Roll Hoocie Coo - Rick Derrenger; 24. Beach Baby - First Class
BONUS DVD: 1. That's The Way I Like It - KC & The Sunshine Band; 2. Le Freak - Norma Jean Wright & Luci Martin; 3. Disco Inferno - The Trammps; 4. You Make Me Fell Like Dancing - Leo Sayer; 5. Boogie, Oogie, Oogie - A Taste Of Honey; 6. December 1963 (Oh, What a Night) - Frankie Valli; 7. Rock the Boat - The Hues Corporation; 8. Get Down Tonight - KC & The Sunshine Band.
